intro: Ida ejirii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Ida ejirii thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
